Package neureka.backend.api

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Algorithm<FinalType extends Algorithm<FinalType>>
    This class is the middle layer of the 3 tier abstraction architecture of this backend.
    Algorithm.ADAgentSupplier  
    Algorithm.BackwardADAnalyzer  
    Algorithm.DeviceFinder  
    Algorithm.DrainInstantiation  
    Algorithm.ForwardADAnalyzer  
    Algorithm.InitialCallHook

    ExecutionCall.DeviceCondition  
    ExecutionCall.Mutator  
    ExecutionCall.OperationTypeCondition  
    ExecutionCall.TensorCompare  
    ExecutionCall.TensorCondition  
    ImplementationFor<TargetDevice extends Device<?>>
    Generally speaking, this interface describes the functionality of an implementation of an execution procedure tailored to a specific Device (interface) instance and Algorithm (interface) instance! Instances of implementations of the ImplementationFor interface are components of instances of implementations of the Algorithm interface, which themselves are components of Operation implementation instances.
    Operation
    This interface is part of the backend API and it embodies the top layer of the 3 tier backend architecture.
    Operation.DefaultOperatorCreator<T>  
    Operation.PrimaryNDAConsumer  
    Operation.PrimaryNDIConsumer  
    Operation.ScalarOperatorCreator<T>  
    Operation.SecondaryNDAConsumer  
    Operation.SecondaryNDIConsumer  
    Operation.TertiaryNDAConsumer  
    Operation.TertiaryNDIConsumer  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ExecutionCall<DeviceType extends Device<?>>
    This class is a simple container holding relevant arguments needed to execute on a targeted Device which is specified by the type parameter below.
    ExecutionCall.ExecutionCallBuilder<DeviceType extends Device<?>>  
    Operation.Utility
    This static utility class contains simple methods used for creating slices of plain old arrays of tensor objects...
    OperationContext
    Instances of this class are execution contexts hosting Operation instances which receive Tsr instances for execution.
    OperationContext.Runner
    This is a very simple class with a single purpose, namely it exposes methods which receive lambda instances in order to then execute them in a given OperationContext, just to then switch back to the original context again.
